prompt: Facts: Baburam (appellant before HC, respondent before SC) was married to Ramvati (deceased) approximately 3 years prior to the incident.; Incident occurred on 09.09.1990 in Village Simaria, District Panna, Madhya Pradesh, where Ramvati resided with Baburam.; Ramvati fell ill on 09.09.1990 and died on 10.09.1990.; Post-mortem examination revealed no external or internal injuries but noted a 'pasty substance' in the stomach.; Viscera report confirmed the presence of Organo Phosphorus pesticide (Aluminium Phosphide).; Prosecution alleged persistent demands for dowry (Rs. 10,000) and associated cruelty and harassment by Baburam towards Ramvati.; Key prosecution witnesses were PW-1 Shyamlal (father), PW-2 Koushalia (mother), and PW-3 Ramadhar (brother of the deceased).; PW-1, PW-2, and PW-3 testified about the dowry demand, Ramvati being sent back for non-payment, and Ramvati complaining of beatings and harassment.; PW-1 and PW-3 specifically mentioned Ramvati being beaten about 15 days before her death.; Some contradictions noted in PW testimonies regarding the exact duration Ramvati stayed at her parental home before being sent back (PW-1 stated 2 months, PW-3 stated 15 days).; The Trial Court convicted Baburam under Sections 302 and 498A of the Indian Penal Code.; The High Court of Madhya Pradesh acquitted Baburam, disbelieving the testimony of PW-1, PW-2, and PW-3 due to contradictions and their status as interested witnesses.; The State of Madhya Pradesh filed an appeal against the acquittal before the Supreme Court. | IPC: Section 302 (Punishment for Murder), Section 498A (Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty)
